t: Jeremiah 18
The Potter and the Clay
The*p word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord*s saying,
“Arise and go down to the potter’s house, and there I will announce My words to you.”
Then I went down to the potter’s house, and there he was, making something on the wheel.
But the vessel that he was making of clay was spoiled in the hand of the potter; so he remade it into another vessel, as it pleased the potter to make.
Then*p the word of the Lord*s came to me saying,
“Can I not, O house of Israel, deal with you as this potter does?”*i declares the Lord.*s “Behold, like the clay in the potter’s hand, so are you in My hand, O house of Israel.
At one moment I might speak concerning a nation or concerning a kingdom to uproot, to pull down, or to destroy it;*i
if that nation against which I have spoken turns from its evil, I will relent concerning the calamity I planned to bring on it.
Or at another moment I might speak concerning a nation or concerning a kingdom to build up or to plant it;*i
if it does evil in My sight by not obeying My voice, then I will think better of the good with which I had promised to bless it.

So now then, speak to the men of Judah and against the inhabitants of Jerusalem saying, ‘Thus says the Lord,*s “Behold, I am fashioning calamity against you and devising a plan against you. Oh turn back, each of you from his evil way, and reform your ways and your deeds.” ’
But they will say, ‘It’s hopeless! For we are going to follow our own plans, and each of us will act according to the stubbornness of his evil heart.’
“Therefore*pn thus says the Lord,*s ‘Ask*ln now among the nations, Who*ln ever heard the like of this? The*ln virgin of Israel Has*ln done a most appalling thing.
Does*ln the snow of Lebanon forsake the rock of the open country? Or*ln is the cold flowing water from*i a foreign land*i ever snatched away?
For*ln My people have forgotten Me, They*ln burn incense to worthless gods And*ln they have stumbled from their ways, From*ln the ancient paths, To*ln walk in bypaths, Not*ln on a highway,
To*ln make their land a desolation, An*iln object*i of*i perpetual hissing; Everyone*ln who passes by it will be astonished And*ln shake his head.
Like*ln an east wind I will scatter them Before*ln the enemy; I*ln will show them My back and not My*i face In*ln the day of their calamity.’ ”

Then*p they said, “Come and let us devise plans against Jeremiah. Surely the law is not going to be lost to the priest, nor counsel to the sage, nor the divine*i word to the prophet! Come on and let us strike at him with our*i tongue, and let us give no heed to any of his words.”
Do*pn give heed to me, O Lord,*s And*ln listen to what my opponents are saying!
Should*ln good be repaid with evil? For*ln they have dug a pit for me. Remember*ln how I stood before You To*ln speak good on their behalf, So*ln as to turn away Your wrath from them.

Therefore,*ln give their children over to famine And*ln deliver them up to the power of the sword; And*ln let their wives become childless and widowed. Let*ln their men also be smitten to death, Their*ln young men struck down by the sword in battle.
May*ln an outcry be heard from their houses, When*ln You suddenly bring raiders upon them; For*ln they have dug a pit to capture me And*ln hidden snares for my feet.

Yet*ln You, O Lord,*s know All*ln their deadly designs against me; Do*ln not forgive their iniquity Or*ln blot out their sin from Your sight. But*ln may they be overthrown before You; Deal*ln with them in the time of Your anger!
